backend.src.app.controllers.rentals package

Submodules

backend.src.app.controllers.rentals.rental_controller module

class backend.src.app.controllers.rentals.rental_controller.RentalController(rental_id, update_data=None)[source]

Bases: object

The RentalController class provides methods for managing rental data.

This class acts as a controller for validating, updating, deleting, and preparing responses related to a rental.

Variables:

  • rental_id – The ID of the rental.

  • update_data – The data to update for the rental.

  • rental_service – An instance of the RentalService class for managing rental data.

close_rental()[source]

Close the rental.

This method uses the rental service to close the rental. If the close data is invalid, it raises a ControllerException.

Raises:

ControllerException – If the rental close data is invalid and HTTP status code 400.

create_response_with_rental_data()[source]

Create a response containing all data about the rental.

This method uses the rental service to retrieve all data about the rental and prepares a response.

Returns:

A dictionary containing all data about the rental and HTTP status code of 200.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, any], int]

create_response_with_successful_close_message()[source]

Create a response with a successful close message.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a success message and HTTP status code of 200.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, str], int]

create_response_with_successful_delete_message()[source]

Create a response with a successful delete message.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a success message and HTTP status code of 200.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, str], int]

create_response_with_successful_update_message()[source]

Create a response with a successful update message.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a success message and HTTP status code of 200.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, str], int]

delete_rental()[source]

Delete the rental.

This method uses the rental service to delete the rental based on their ID.

update_rental()[source]

Update the rental’s data.

This method uses the rental service to update the rental’s data. If the update data is invalid, it raises a ControllerException.

Raises:

ControllerException – If the rental update data is invalid and HTTP status code 400.

validate_rental()[source]

Validate the rental’s existence.

This method uses the rental service to validate the existence of the rental based on their ID. If the rental does not exist, it raises a ControllerException.

Raises:

ControllerException – If the rental does not exist and HTTP status code 404.

backend.src.app.controllers.rentals.rentals_controller module

class backend.src.app.controllers.rentals.rentals_controller.RentalsController(rental_data=None)[source]

Bases: object

The RentalsController class provides methods for handling rental-related requests.

This class acts as a controller that uses the RentalsService for creating a new rental and preparing data related to all rentals.

Variables:

  • rental_data – The data for creating a new rental.

  • rentals_service – An instance of the RentalsService class for managing rentals’ data.

create_client()[source]

Create a new rental.

This method uses the rentals service to create a new rental with the provided data. If the rental data is invalid, it raises a ControllerException.

Raises:

ControllerException – If the rental data is invalid with HTTP code 400.

create_response_with_rentals_data()[source]

Prepare a response containing data about all rentals.

This method uses the rentals service to retrieve data about all rentals.

Returns:

A tuple where the first item is a list of data about all rentals and the second item is the HTTP status code 200.

Return type:

tuple[list[dict[str, any]], int]

create_response_with_successful_create_message()[source]

Prepare a response containing a success message for rental creation.

Returns:

A tuple where the first item is a dictionary containing a success message and the second item is the HTTP status code 200.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, str], int]

backend.src.app.controllers.rentals.rentals_sort_controller module

class backend.src.app.controllers.rentals.rentals_sort_controller.RentalsSortController(sort_data)[source]

Bases: object

The RentalsSortController class provides methods for sorting rentals and creating an appropriate response.

This class acts as a controller for handling requests related to sorting rentals.

Variables:

  • sort_data – The data specifying how rentals should be sorted.

  • sorted_rentals – The sorted rental data.

create_response_with_sorted_rentals_data()[source]

Create a response containing the sorted rental data.

This method prepares a response with the sorted rental data. The response includes a 200 status code.

Returns:

The response containing the sorted rental data and a 200 status code.

Return type:

tuple[list[dict[str, any]], int]

sort_rentals()[source]

Sort rental data based on the provided parameters.

This method uses the RentalsSortService to sort all rentals based on the sorting data. If the sorting fails, it raises a ControllerException.

Raises:

ControllerException – If the sorting fails due to invalid sort QUERY parameters.
